page.title: 10SERVICES FOR NEWQUAY
page.content: At{PORTH WATER WORKS}the water is treated to make it drinkable.It comes from the Porth River which was dammed to create{PORTH RESERVOIR. Most of } the water goes to the Newquay area and St.Mawgan.It is purified by adding chemicals and by filtering through four feet of sand.The water works (built in 1925) cleans about 2 million gallons of water a day in the Summer and 1 million gallons a day in the winter. The site has always been powered by electricity and when there is a power cut there is a standby diesel engine.This is importnat if there is a coal strike for example, when power is not available through the {"NATIONAL ELECTRICITY GRID"} There are five farms in our area one of which is called "High Lanes",owned by Mr Hicks who has been farming there all of his life.
